content: and make that half_double_crochet in to the 6th stitch 1hdc ch5 1hdc but skip 5 sts from r2 and make that half_double_crochet in to the 6th stitch 1hdc 2sc 1slst ch1 turn work r4 - single_crochet 10 double_crochet decrease single_crochet ch1 turn work r5 - 6 double_crochet decrease ch1 turn work r6 - 3 double_crochet decrease ch1 cut yarn and tight the loop by pulling the tail ribbons chain 12 leaving a 2cm/1inch tail slip_stitch in to the bottom part of a bonnet in the side where is tail from r1 of a bonnet slip_stitch in to the edge you need to pick an edge where you finish round 6 of a bonnet all across untill you reach last chain from r1 of a bonnet in that step you are not crocheating through the all r1 of a bonnet chain 12 cut yarn leave a 2cm/1inch end and tight the loop by pulling the tail weave the tails of a bonnet body part using sewing needle fluff the tails of a ribbons cut fluff so it will be 1cm/0 5inch top part use a green yarn for a strawberry or cherry tomato bonnet use blue clour for the blueberry here is a small scheme step 1 - you will start with a chain 4 and slip_stitch in to the first chain created ring i will call a main chain step 2 - ch2 and slip_stitch in to the 2nd loop from the hook slip_stitch in to the next st of main chain repeat step 2 three more times ch1 cut yarn leave a 15cm/6inch tail and tight the loop by pulling the tail you crochet a flat top part using tapestry needle pull the 15cm tail through all 4 sprouts tight a little bit the created loop by pulling the tail so the flat sprouts will become more like a flower shape using the remaining tails and a tapestry needle sew the flower on top of a bonnet between the gaps for ears for a strawberry bonnet using a tapestry needle and a light yellow yarn create small stitches all across the red body of a bonnet all done
